qas.question: When was the Bretton Woods system established?
What was the fixed value of gold?
What was the value of the U.S. dollar linked to?
What did banks and investors do that devalued the dollar?
In which year was gold convertability terminated?
When was the Nixon Woods system established?
What was the fixed value of stocks?
What was the value of the Nixon investors linked to?
What did banks and investors do that terminated the dollar?
In which year were dollars terminated?

context: Under the Bretton Woods system established <a0_0><b5_0>after World War II<b5_0/><a0_0/>, <b7_0>the value of gold<b7_0/> was fixed to <a1_0><b6_0>$35 per ounce<b6_0/><a1_0/>, and the value of the U.S. dollar was thus anchored to <a2_0>the value of gold<a2_0/>. Rising government spending in the 1960s, however, led to doubts about the ability of the United States to maintain this convertibility, gold stocks dwindled as banks and international investors began to <a3_0><b8_0>convert dollars to gold<b8_0/><a3_0/>, and as a result the value of the dollar began to decline. Facing an emerging currency crisis and the imminent danger that the United States would no longer be able to redeem dollars for gold, gold convertibility was finally terminated in <a4_0><b9_0>1971<b9_0/><a4_0/> by President Nixon, resulting in the "Nixon shock".
